ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot more about how to write different types of academic essays as well as how to analyze text on a deeper level.

I gained a lot of experience and direction in how to write essays about literature. This included both writing about my own interpretation of the texts and doing in depth research on a topic. I also developed my ability to read texts in depth.

The class furthered my ability to do close readings of texts and write critical essays and a research paper. The course specifically taught the style of reading to identify a problem and writing to address that problem.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I found the materials we read and watched to be engaging and interesting.

Strengths: Good variety of types of essay / types of works examined (included poems, essays, short stories, movies, database searches). I also really liked how the course focused on one particular topic which we went deeply into, rather than a more typical "intro to English" class. Also, it was really nice how there was usually low stress "rough drafts" due before the actual deadline for papers, it greatly removed stress!
Weaknesses: can't think of one off the top of my head.

The course had a manageable workload, kept me engaged with class discussions, and the topics and questions proposed kept me interested. All my grades on my work felt fair and I received a lot of focused feedback that helped me improve my writing. The only weaknesses were that discussions would sometimes go quiet or have long pauses, but just because no one had anything to say and we would move on to a new topic.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to anyone interested in Dolls, Puppets, and AI!
Yes, I really would, for the reasons I gave in the strength section. It is a really fun and engaging class to get the writing credit, and I feel that I improved a fair bit as a writer!
Yes! This was a very interesting writing class and I think anyone intrigued by the topic would enjoy it.

extras.title: ENGL 114 28 - On Dolls, Puppets, and AI
